title.narrative: Improve access to sexual and reproductive health services for Haitian women of reproductive age affected by Hurricane Matthew and/or displaced in Grand Anse, South and West Departments

description.narrative: The main objective of this project is to improve access to comprehensive sexual and reproductive health services for women of reproductive age (15-49 years) affected by Hurricane Matthew and/or displaced in the Grand'Anse, Sud and Ouest departments. UNFPA will use CERF funds to increase access to family planning as well as to improve clinical management of GBV/sexual violence, maternal and new-born care, prevention and treatment of STIs including HIV. 10,000 women will benefit from this project, which will be implemented within 9 months.

owner-org.narrative: UN OCHA Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF)

organisation.narrative: UN Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA)

mailing-address.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA), Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF), 2 United Nations Plaza (DC2), East 44th street (13th floor), United Nations, New York, USA

name.narrative: Grand Anse, South & West Departments, Haiti

description.narrative: Disbursement to CERF Project Improve access to sexual and reproductive health services for Haitian women of reproductive age affected by Hurricane Matthew and/or displaced in Grand Anse, South and West Departments

title.narrative: RESIDENT / HUMANITARIAN COORDINATOR REPORT ON THE USE OF CERF FUNDS HAITI UNDERFUNDED EMERGENCIES STORM 2018

condition.narrative: CERF funding is based on an agreed proposal, including specific planned outcomes and outputs.

description.narrative: Monitor the quality and effectiveness of project implementation
A Monitoring and evaluation plan is elaborated with implementing partners and the affected population
Final evaluation completed and report is available
Mid-term progress report based on a monitoring missions by UNFPA team and implementing partners

Reinforced community-based comprehensive sexual and reproductive health services and referral to Emergency Obstetric and Neonatal Care (SONU) facilities reach Haitian women of reproductive age (15-49 years) affected by Hurricane Matthew and/or displaced in Grand Anse, South and West Departments

Number of displaced women of reproductive age (15-49 years) in Delmas accessing at least one component of the sexual and reproductive health services (sensitization, maternal and newborn health, family planning, sexual and gender based violence services, or HIV/STI prevention treatment and care)

Number of displaced women of reproductive age (15-49 years) in Grand Anse and South departments accessing at least one component of the sexual and reproductive health services (sensitization, maternal and newborn health, family planning, sexual and gender based violence services, or HIV/STI prevention treatment and care)

Number of women of reproductive age (15-49 years) in communes severely affected by Hurricane Matthew in Grand Anse and South accessing at least one component of the sexual and reproductive health services (sensitization, maternal and newborn health, family planning, sexual and gender based violence services, or HIV/STI prevention treatment and care)
Number of women of reproductive age (15-49 years) receiving a dignity kit while accessing sexual and gender based violence services at selected SONU in project areas

Strengthened capacity of selected health facilities to provide integrated, quality life saving comprehensive sexual and reproductive health services to women of reproductive age (15-49 years) affected by Hurricane Matthew and/or displaced in Grand Anse, South and West Departments
Number of area-specific sexual and reproductive health work plans developed
Number of health personnel trained on Minimum Initial Services Package for reproductive Health in emergencies (MISP) and Clinical management of rape (CMR)
Number of inter-agency reproductive health kit 3 (clinical management of rape) procured
Number of qualified midwives/nurse midwives deployed to reinforce selected SONU in project areas
Number of selected health facilities/SONU in project areas that receive components of the inter-agency reproductive health kit 3 (clinical management of rape)
Number of selected health facilities/SONU in project areas with sufficient essential medicines and equipment (obstetric delivery tables and newborn cribs) and consumables
